description: Ecuador closes all schools, from March 12 to April 5 UPDATE: On August 21st, the National Emergency Operations Committee (COE) will approve the plan for progressive and voluntary return to classes, which would be implemented starting September 1st. Sending students to face-to-face classes is voluntary, each school day will be four hours long, students will only go to school one day per week, and only 12 will be allowed in each classroom.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)

description:
Ecuador imposes a curfew from 21.00 to 5.00 on people, public transportation and other non-essentials residents.
Taxis and comparable services are just allowed to drive on certain days depending on the last digit on their serial number plate.

Ecuador imposes a curfew from 21.00 to 5.00, starting March 17 on all residents, excluding staff of medical, animal caring, banking, governmental, communication institutions and public services. Taxis and similar services are just allowed to drive on specific days depending on the last digit of their serial number plate.

description:
The Minister of Government, Maria Paula Romo, said Wednesday afternoon that the bans already in force in Quito are extended to all the cantons of Pichincha and the cantons of 13 other provinces.

Measures: the prohibition of meetings in closed places (in the rest of the cantons of the country meetings of up to 25 people are authorized), 
the extension of the curfew from 21:00 to 05:00 (in the rest of the yellow localities it is maintained from 23:00 to 05:00).
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Government of Ecuador. COE orders curfew from 21:00 to 05:00 in Quito and three cantons this Friday, August 14

description:
The curfew issued on Friday, August 14, 2020, by the President of Ecuador, who renewed the state of emergency for 30 days, is renewed. 
The instrument provides for the mobilization of the Armed Forces; August 16, 2020
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Government of Ecuador. This Sunday a differentiated curfew schedule is applied in cantons with yellow traffic light in Ecuador. The measure will last six hours, from 23:00 to 05:00 in six provinces: Guayas, Santa Elena, Manabi, Los Rios, El Oro and Galapagos.  The COE decided that the curfew, instead, will be extended for 10 hours, from 19:00 to 05:00 this Sunday 16 in Quito and cantons of 18 provinces: Carchi, Imbabura, Pichincha, Cotopaxi, Tungurahua, Chimborazo, Bolivar, Cañar, Azuay, Loja, Esmeraldas, Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, Sucumbíos, Napo, Orellana, Pastaza, Morona Santiago and Zamora Chinchipe.
 August 16, 2020
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Government of Quito (Ecuador). The special measures that applied to the city of Quito and 18 provinces of Ecuador ended on August 31, so they must comply with the provisions of the authorities depending on the color of the epidemiological traffic light in which they are, either red, yellow or green. Among the provisions were the extension of the curfew from 19:00 to 05:00 on Fridays,

description: (Government of Ecuador) The national CEO announces that as of Wednesday, July 1, 2020, private vehicles with license plates ending in the odd digit will be allowed to circulate on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays, as well as on Sundays 5 and 19. Likewise, on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays 12 and 26 July, cars with license plates ending in the even digit will be allowed to circulate. Conventional and executive cab units; mixed transport and light cargo; and institutional transport will be able to circulate in this month every day without license plate restriction.

description:
(Government of Ecuador) The National Emergency Operations Committee (COE) issued for all of Ecuador that for July 30 2020: 
-International land borders remain closed.
-On-site classes at different educational levels remain suspended.
-The opening and operation of recreational centers remains prohibited.
-Prohibition of spectacles and agglomerations.
-Beaches will open on August 5th.
